title: Why do they have to put nitrates and nitrites in meat? - Quora

response.answer_text: To preserve it. Meat spends a lot of time being stocked and transported around once it is cut from the animal, to ensure that it doesn’t spoil even if there are cold-cycle mishaps, processed/ industrial meat is loaded with preservatives of different sorts.

You mainly find it in processed meats here in Switzerland. It has two aims, one in favour of the customer, one a bit less so: it helps keep the product edible;nitrites/nitrates are salts which help the product keep moist, hence heavier. And a tad more expensive…
